Article.Abstract: We engineered a multiepitope DNA minigene encoding nine dominant HLA-A2.1- and A11-restricted epitopes from the polymerase, envelope, and core proteins of hepatitis B virus and HIV, together with the PADRE (pan-DR epitope) universal Th cell epitope and an endoplasmic reticulum-translocating signal sequence. Immunization of HLA transgenic mice with this construct resulted in: 1) simultaneous CTL induction against all nine CTL epitopes despite their varying MHC binding affinities; 2) CTL responses that were equivalent in magnitude to those induced against a lipopeptide known be immunogenic in humans; 3) induction of memory CTLs up to 4 mo after a single DNA injection; 4) higher epitope-specific CTL responses than immunization with DNA encoding whole protein; and 5) a correlation between the immunogenicity of DNA-encoded epitopes in vivo and the in vitro responses of specific CTL lines against minigene DNA-transfected target cells. Examination of potential variables in minigene construct design revealed that removal of the PADRE Th cell epitope or the signal sequence, and changing the position of selected epitopes, affected the magnitude and frequency of CTL responses. Our results demonstrate the simultaneous induction of broad CTL responses in vivo against multiple dominant HLA-restricted epitopes using a minigene DNA vaccine and underline the utility of HLA transgenic mice in development and optimization of vaccine constructs for human use.
Article.ArticleTitle: Utilization of MHC class I transgenic mice for development of minigene DNA vaccines encoding multiple HLA-restricted CTL epitopes.
Article.Affiliations: Epimmune, San Diego, CA 92121, USA. gishioka@epimmune.com
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;HLA Antigens;Histocompatibility Antigens Class I;Protein Sorting Signals;Vaccines, DNA
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Antigen Presentation(genetics); Base Sequence; Binding Sites(genetics; immunology); Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(genetics; immunology; physiology); Genetic Vectors(chemical synthesis; immunology); HIV-1(genetics; immunology); HLA Antigens(genetics; immunology); Hepatitis B virus(genetics; immunology); Histocompatibility Antigens Class I(genetics; immunology; metabolism); Humans; Jurkat Cells; Mice; Mice, Transgenic; Molecular Sequence Data; Protein Sorting Signals(immunology); T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology); Transfection; Vaccines, DNA(genetics; immunology)
Article.Comments: Data originally imported from the HLA Ligand Database (http://hlaligand.ouhsc.edu/)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was imported from the TopBank database and updated in the IEDB.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid DNA containing peptides unrelated to the epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were stimulated in vitro twice with the epitope to analyze primary in vitro CTL induction.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Significant levels of primary in vitro CTL induction to the epitope presented by Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells was not observed in most cultures.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized at the base of the tail with the epitope and 140 µg Th epitope, HBV Core 128-140 (TPPAYRPPNAPIL). Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro with the epitope.

TCell.LocationOfData: Figures 2, 4, 6 and Tables II and III

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid pMin.1 DNA, containing the epitope and 8 other CTL epitopes, a signal sequence and a Th cell PADRE epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro twice with the epitope. In separate experiments, mice were boosted with 100 µg pMin.1 DNA at 8 weeks and splenocytes were taken at 18 weeks and stimulated in vitro with epitope. Splenocytes from mice receiving a single immunization were also taken at 18 weeks for comparison of the memory response. In separate experiments, mice were immunized with pMin.1 DNA with the Th cell PADRE peptide or the signal sequence deleted or the order of the epitopes switched.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA lysed Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells in the presence of the epitope. Epitope specific CTL lines also lysed Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells transfected with the pMin.1 construct, indicating the epitope was efficiently processed from the minigene polypeptide. CTL showed a strong memory response to the epitope 18 weeks after the primary immunization. Boosting did not significantly increase this response. Deletion of the Th PADRE peptide from the pMin.1 DNA immunogen reduced the frequency of positive CTL cultures, whereas deletion of the signal sequence did not have a significant effect.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid pMin.1 DNA, containing the epitope and 8 other CTL epitopes, a signal sequence and a Th cell PADRE epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro weekly with the epitope to establish CTL lines.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Epitope specific CTL lines from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA produced IFN-gamma in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat A2.1/Kb cells. Epitope specific CTL lines also responded to Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells transfected with the pMin.1 construct, indicating the epitope was efficiently processed from the minigene polypeptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was imported from the TopBank database and updated in the IEDB.

TCell.LocationOfData: Figures 2, 4, 6 and Table II, III and IV

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid pMin.1 DNA, containing the epitope and 8 other CTL epitopes, a signal sequence and a Th cell PADRE epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro twice with the epitope. In separate experiments, mice were boosted with 100 µg pMin.1 DNA at 8 weeks and splenocytes were taken at 18 weeks and stimulated in vitro with epitope. Splenocytes from mice receiving a single immunization were also taken at 18 weeks for comparison of the memory response. In separate experiments, mice were immunized with pMin.1 DNA with the Th cell PADRE peptide or the signal sequence deleted or the order of the epitopes switched.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA lysed Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells in the presence of the epitope. Epitope specific CTL lines also lysed Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells transfected with the pMin.1 construct, indicating the epitope was efficiently processed from the minigene polypeptide. CTL showed a memory response to the epitope 18 weeks after the primary immunization. Boosting increase the consistency of this response. Deletion of the Th PADRE peptide or the signal sequence from the pMin.1 DNA immunogen reduced the response to the epitope. Switching the position of the epitope in the immunogen also reduced the response.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid DNA containing peptides unrelated to the epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were stimulated in vitro twice with the epitope to analyze primary in vitro CTL induction.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Significant levels of primary in vitro CTL induction to the epitope presented by Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells was not observed in most cultures.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized at the base of the tail with the epitope and 140 µg Th epitope, HBV Core 128-140 (TPPAYRPPNAPIL). Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro with the epitope.

Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid encoding the entire HBV polymerase. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro twice with the epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from mice immunized with plasmid encoding the HBV polymerase lysed Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells in the presence of the epitope. The response was weaker than in mice immunized with pMin.1 plasmid DNA, encoding the epitope and 8 other CTL epitopes, Th cell PADRE peptide, and a signal peptide.

Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro weekly with the epitope to establish CTL lines.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Epitope specific CTL lines from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA produced IFN-gamma in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat A2.1/Kb cells. Epitope specific CTL lines also responded to Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells transfected with the pMin.1 construct, indicating the epitope was efficiently processed from the minigene polypeptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was imported from the TopBank database and updated in the IEDB.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid pMin.1 DNA, containing the epitope and 8 other CTL epitopes, a signal sequence and a Th cell PADRE epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro twice with the epitope. In separate experiments, mice were immunized with pMin.1 DNA with the Th cell PADRE peptide or the signal sequence deleted or the order of the epitopes switched.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA lysed Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells in the presence of the epitope. Deletion of the Th cell PADRE peptide or signal sequence from the pMin.1 DNA immunogen reduced the frequency of positive CTL cultures. Switching the positions of two other epitopes in the pMin.1 construct abolished the response to the epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA lysed 3A4-721.221 tumor cells transfected with A11/Kb in the presence of the epitope.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was imported from the TopBank database and updated in the IEDB.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized at the base of the tail with the epitope and 140 µg Th epitope, HBV Core 128-140 (TPPAYRPPNAPIL). Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro with the epitope.

TCell.LocationOfData: Figures 2, 4, 6 and Tables II and III

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid pMin.1 DNA, containing the epitope and 8 other CTL epitopes, a signal sequence and a Th cell PADRE epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro twice with the epitope. In separate experiments, mice were boosted with 100 µg pMin.1 DNA at 8 weeks and splenocytes were taken at 18 weeks and stimulated in vitro with epitope. Splenocytes from mice receiving a single immunization were also taken at 18 weeks for comparison of the memory response. In separate experiments, mice were immunized with pMin.1 DNA with the Th cell PADRE peptide or the signal sequence deleted or the order of the epitopes switched.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA lysed Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells in the presence of the epitope. Epitope specific CTL lines did not recognize Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells transfected with the pMin.1 construct, indicating the epitope was not efficiently processed from the minigene polypeptide. CTL showed a strong memory response to the epitope 18 weeks after the primary immunization. Boosting did not significantly increase this response. Deletion of the Th cell PADRE peptide or signal sequence from the pMin.1 DNA immunogen reduced the frequency of positive CTL cultures. Switching the position of the epitope in the pMin.1 construct from the 3 ' to the center of the minigene abolished the response to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid pMin.1 DNA, containing the epitope and 8 other CTL epitopes, a signal sequence and a Th cell PADRE epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro weekly with the epitope to establish CTL lines.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Epitope specific CTL lines from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA produced IFN-gamma in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat A2.1/Kb cells. Epitope specific CTL lines responded weakly to Jurkat A2.1/Kb cells transfected with the pMin.1 construct, indicating the epitope was not efficiently processed from the minigene polypeptide.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid DNA containing peptides unrelated to the epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were stimulated in vitro twice with the epitope to analyze primary in vitro CTL induction.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Significant levels of primary in vitro CTL induction to the epitope presented by Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells was not observed in most cultures.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was imported from the TopBank database and updated in the IEDB.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized at the base of the tail with the epitope and 140 µg Th epitope, HBV Core 128-140 (TPPAYRPPNAPIL). Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro with the epitope.

TCell.LocationOfData: Figure 2, 6 and Tables II, III and IV

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid pMin.1 DNA, containing the epitope and 8 other CTL epitopes, a signal sequence and a Th cell PADRE epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro twice with the epitope. In separate experiments, mice were boosted with 100 µg pMin.1 DNA at 8 weeks and splenocytes were taken at 18 weeks and stimulated in vitro with epitope. Splenocytes from mice receiving a single immunization were also taken at 18 weeks for comparison of the memory response. In separate experiments, mice were immunized with pMin.1 DNA with the Th cell PADRE peptide or the signal sequence deleted or the order of the epitopes switched.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from mice immunized with pMin.1 DNA lysed Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells in the presence of the epitope. CTL showed a strong memory response to the epitope 18 weeks after the primary immunization. Boosting increased this response. Deletion of the Th PADRE peptide or signal ssequence from the pMin.1 DNA immunogen or switching the order of epitopes did not have a significant effect on the response to the epitope. The pMin.1 construct containing the epitope or the analog with increased MHC binding (with an Ala to Val substitution at anchor position 9) were equally effective in inducing a response to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid encoding the entire HBV polymerase. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were restimulated in vitro twice with the epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from mice immunized with plasmid encoding the HBV polymerase did not lyse Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells in the presence of the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with cardiotoxin 4 to 5 days before immunization with plasmid DNA containing peptides unrelated to the epitope. Spleens were removed 11 to 14 days after immunization and splenocytes were stimulated in vitro twice with the epitope to analyze primary in vitro CTL induction.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Significant levels of primary in vitro CTL induction to the epitope presented by Jurkat A2.1/Kb target cells was not observed in most cultures.
